abstract: New York City Police Commissioner William J Bratton says June 2015 had lowest crime rate of any June since his first stint leading Police Dept in 1994 and that city is on track to record fewer than 100,000 major crimes for entire year.
lead_paragraph: While the city is poised to have fewer than 100,000 crimes for the year, which would be a record, the number of shootings and homicides are higher than in 2014.

headline.main: June Crimes in New York City at Lowest Since ’94
headline.print_headline: June Crimes in City at Lowest Since ’94

snippet: While the city is poised to have fewer than 100,000 crimes for the year, which would be a record, the number of shootings and homicides are higher than in 2014.
